Name: Poetto
Description: Vibrant beach area popular for swimming & sunbathing, plus nearby restaurants, dance clubs & bars.

Name: Bastion Saint Remy
Description: Landmark structure with a limestone arch & pillars, plus a terrace & promenade for cultural events.

Name: Museo archeologico nazionale
Description: Museum exploring Sardinia's ancient history via archaeological exhibits, including Punic jewelry.

Name: Santuario di Nostra Signora di Bonaria
Description: Part of a 14th-century complex, this sanctuary holds a revered, storied statue of the Virgin Mary.
Image: Santuario di Nostra Signora di Bonaria.jpg

Name: Parco di Monte Urpinu
Description: Large public park on hilltop, with tree-lined avenues & kids' playground, plus panoramic views.

Name: Parco Naturale Molentargius Saline
Description: Ample urban wetland with fresh & saltwater ponds, diverse bird species, paths & bike rentals.

Name: Sella del diavolo
Description: Saddle-shaped promontory offering scenic hilltop views of the sea, with trails to the summit.
OpeningTime: {'Monday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Thursday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Friday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Saturday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Sunday': 'Open 24 hours'}

Name: Orto Botanico di Cagliari
Description: Historic garden featuring trees & plants including tropical, succulent & Mediterranean varieties.
Address: Via Sant'Ignazio da Laconi, 11, 09123 Cagliari CA

Name: Chiesa di San Michele
Description: Church of Saint Michele St. Michele's church was built over St. Michele's and St. Egidio's oratory, at the end of 17th century, as headquarters of the Jesuit order. It is located next to the ancient "House of the Novitiate", where today there is the Military Hospital, and both share the same entrance.

Name: Torre dell'Elefante
Description: Imposing, 14th-century limestone tower adorned with a sculpted elephant, offering views of the city.

Name: Tower of San Pancrazio
Description: The St.Pancras Tower is one of the most recognisable figures in Cagliari's landscape. Restored to its original appearance, it is now open to visitors with access from the adjacent Palazzo delle Seziate.

Name: Cittadella dei Musei
Description: The greatest art, history and culture complex in the capital and in the whole of Sardinia, allowing you to move between Eastern art, archaeological artefacts and paintings.

Name: Galleria Comunale d'Arte
Description: Housed in a neoclassical villa in the Giardini Pubblici (Public Gardens) north of the Castello, this terrific gallery focuses on modern and contemporary art. Works by many of Sardinia's top artists are on show, alongside paintings and sculptures from the Collezione Ingrao

Name: Museo delle Cere Anatomiche
Description: Contemporary space featuring a collection of wax figures to teach visitors about the human body.

Name: Parco Terramaini
Description: Terramaini Park is a green space that spreads over 8 hectares in the northern part of the city. It is a great place for walking and jogging, or to do some exercise between the mediterranean scrub and the flamingo's pond, that is home of other species such as the herring gulls.

Name: MUTSEU - Museo del Tesoro e Area Archeologica di Sant'Eulalia
Description: The Sant'Eulalia (Mutseu) museum consists of a journey stretching over 2,000 years through the history of Cagliari, especially in the ancient nucleus built near the port, which includes countless monuments
Image: MUTSEU - Museo del Tesoro e Area Archeologica di Sant'Eulalia.jpg

Name: Monte Claro Park
Description: Natural area with walking/jogging paths, 2 dog parks, a pond & abundant wildlife viewing.
Address: Via Cadello, Via Mattei, Cagliari, IT 09100

Name: Chiesa di Sant'Efisio a Giorgino
Description: Church of Saint Efisio (Giorgino) The church was built in the XVII century, on the premises close to the main house of Ballero family , forming a single complex. It has an octagonal dome finely decorated , and a simple fa?ade with a belfry in which is located the bell, date back to 1679.

Name: Cripta di Santa Restituta
Description: The crypt of Santa Restituta, one of the symbols of the picturesque neighbourhood of Stampace, has had a turbulent history, marked by periods of abandonment and with a happy ending in the restoration during the 1970s.

Name: Marina Portus Karalis
Description: Portus Karalis Marina is located in the Port of Cagliari in the heart of the city. A strategic position along the Mediterranean routes to the French Riviera and the Spanish coastmakes it an ideal stopping place. The only marina in southern Sardinia that can host yachts up to 90 m long and longer
OpeningTime: {'Monday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Thursday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Friday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Saturday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Sunday': 'Open 24 hours'}

Name: Palazzo Regio
Description: Opulent palace & former royal residence, now hosting exhibitions, concerts & public visits.

Name: Castello di San Michele Cagliari
Description: Built in the 12th century, this fortified castle now houses the City Center of Art & Culture.

Name: Giardini Pubblici
Description: Tranquil park, developed in the 19th century, known for its French-style gardens & sculptures.

Name: Monumental Cemetery of Bonaria
Description: Tombs & charnel houses on a cave-pitted limestone hill, with mausoleum paintings by Filippo Figari.

Name: Porticciolo Turistico Marina Piccola
Description: This marina can be found on the eastern side of the Capri Island and it is a part of the province of Cagliari and the historic region of Sardinia.
OpeningTime: {'Monday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Thursday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Friday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Saturday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Sunday': 'Open 24 hours'}
Address: Porticciolo di Marina Piccola, 09126 Cagliari CA

Name: Chiesa di Santo Sepolcro
Description: The church of San Sepolcro, in the heart of the district of Marina di Cagliari, has an ancient and fascinating history, which probably began in the 14th century and is linked, according to some scholars, to the figures of the Knights Templar

Name: Orto dei Cappuccini
Description: The Botanical Gardens are shaped like a trapezoid and cover an area of about five hectares at the lower end of the Palabenda valley, in an area that includes the Anfiteatro romano, Orto dei cappuccini vegetable garden and villa di Tigellio
Address: Vico I' Luigi Merello, 09123 Cagliari CA

Name: Teatro Lirico di Cagliari
Description: Cagliari Teatro Lirico, seat of the Foundation of the same name, features concert, opera and ballet seasons all year long. On its stage, together with the Teatro Lirico Orchestra and Chorus, protagonists of many prestigious productions

Name: Necropoli di Tuvixeddu
Description: Archaeological area at a large hillside necropolis featuring Carthaginian & Roman burial chambers.

Name: Antico Palazzo di Citta?
Description: Restored historic palace-turned-museum featuring temporary exhibitions of contemporary artwork.

Name: Palazzo Civico di Cagliari
Description: Cagliari's Palazzo Civico, or City Hall, rises above the harbour like a bastion of white stone, elegant in shape and colours, perfectly in tune with the other old buildings that line Via Roma. City Hall was originally located at Piazza Palazzo in the Castello quarter,

Name: Chiesa Collegiata di Sant'Anna
Description: Largely destroyed by bombing in 1943 but painstakingly rebuilt afterwards, Chiesa di Sant'Anna rises grandly above a wide staircase in the Stampace district. More impressive outside than in, it's fronted by a towering two-tier baroque facade topped by a pair of matching bell towers.
Address: Via Domenico Alberto Azuni, 09124 Cagliari CA

Name: Teatro Massimo
Description: The Teatro Massimo is a historic opera house in Cagliari, Sardinia. It hosts a variety of events, such as operas, ballets, concerts and web TV shows. See the schedule and book tickets online.
Address: Via E. De Magistris, 12, 09123 Cagliari CA

Name: Basilica di San Saturnino
Description: Paleo-Christian church dating to the 5th century, featuring a lofty, towering domed roof & apse.

Name: Parco delle Rimembranze
Description: The park is dedicated to the fallen of the First World War and was created in the wake of the avenues of Remembrance that arose in Italy starting from 1923. It was built in 1935 based on a design by the assistant architect Ubaldo Badas. The monument is of sober taste and consists of two bundles of trachyte and Serrenti stone on which the dates of the most important battles of the great war are shown. Between the two beams is the exedra on whose structure the names of the fallen are written.
OpeningTime: {'Monday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Thursday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Friday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Saturday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Sunday': 'Open 24 hours'}

Name: Faro di Capo Sant'Elia
Description: Capo Sant'Elia Lighthouse is an active lighthouse located on Capo Sant'Elia promontory, adjacent to Calamosca Bay which separates the Golfo degli Angeli from that of Quartu Sant'Elena.
OpeningTime: {'Monday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Thursday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Friday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Saturday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Sunday': 'Open 24 hours'}

Name: Parco della Musica
Description: The Music Park is a multifunctional complex in Cagliari created to host various types of musical and cultural events; it was inaugurated on 7 May 2011, on the occasion of the Open Monuments event, with the opening of the open spaces, including Piazza Amedeo Nazzari, while the total opening of the new theater spaces will also take place in the summer of 2011.

Name: Galleria Rifugio Don Bosco
Description: Air-Raid Refuge Don Bosco The gallery refuge extends for about 180 meters along a parallel and equidistant axis from Viale Merello to Viale Fra Ignazio. It was part of a series of underground routes still existing, made in 1700 by the Piedmontese outside the walls for military purposes.

Name: EXMA - Centro Comunale d'Arte e Cultura
Description: Transformed in 1993 into a splendid multipurpose centre, it hosts art exhibitions, shows and events of great appeal. Since 2015 it has been home to the EXMA - Exhibiting and Moving Arts project, focused on contemporary arts and curated by the Camù Consortium. Located in the heart of Cagliari, in the historic Villanova district, the former slaughterhouse was one of the first urban spaces to be restored and returned to the citizens. Guarded between high walls, embellished with a garden courtyard that makes it seem like an oasis in the traffic of the city center, the Exma is certainly one of the liveliest "cultural salons" of the island capital.
Image: EXMA - Centro Comunale d'Arte e Cultura.jpg

Name: Unipol Domus
Description: The Unipol Domus, formerly known as Sardegna Arena, is an Italian football stadium in Cagliari, Sardinia. Located in the Nuovo Borgo Sant'Elia district, it has been home to Cagliari Calcio's home matches since the 2017-2018 season.
Address: Via Raimondo Carta Raspi, 09126 Cagliari CA

Name: Museo d'Arte Siamese Stefano Cardu
Description: The Stefano Cardu civic museum of Siamese art is located inside the Citadel of Museums, the museum complex located in the Castle of Cagliari.
Address: Cittadella dei Musei, Piazza Arsenale, 1, 09123 Cagliari CA

Name: Pinacoteca Nazionale Di Cagliari
Description: The National Art Gallery of Cagliari, located within the museum complex of the Citadel of Museums, is located in Piazza Arsenale 1 in Cagliari and exhibits various collections derived from both private donations and state acquisitions.

Name: Chiesa di Santa Chiara
Description: The church of Santa Chiara is a church in Cagliari, located on the Santa Chiara hill, not far from Piazza Yenne, in the Stampace district.
Address: Salita di Santa Chiara, 09124 Cagliari CA

Name: Fortino di Sant'Ignazio
Description: The fort of Sant'Ignazio or Fort of Sant'Ignazio is a military architecture located on the hill of Sant'Elia, in the municipality of Cagliari. It rises approximately 94 meters above sea level.
OpeningTime: {'Monday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Thursday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Friday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Saturday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Sunday': 'Open 24 hours'}

Name: Chiesa di Santa Rosalia
Description: The church of Santa Rosalia is a church in the historic center of Cagliari, located in via Torino, in the Marina district. The temple, known above all for guarding the tomb of Saint Savior of Horta, is officiated by the Friars Minor who reside in the adjacent convent.

Name: Teatro Civico di Castello
Description: The Civic Theater of Cagliari, recently restored and used again, is located in via Mario de Candia, in the Castello district, adjacent to Palazzo Boyl and not far from the Bastion of Saint Remy.

Name: Museo Diocesano del Duomo
Description: The museum structure wants to represent a place of encounter and cultural growth, where sacred art testifies to the religious sentiment of the Christian community and documents the historical journey of the diocesan territory, within and beyond the borders of the city, even in relation to minor realities.

Name: Basilica Magistrale Mauriziana di Santa Croce
Description: The magisterial basilica of Santa Croce is a monumental church in Cagliari, originally a synagogue of the local Jewish community before the expulsion of 1492. Since 1809 the church has belonged to the Order of Saints Maurice and Lazarus.
Image: Basilica Magistrale Mauriziana di Santa Croce.jpg

Name: Porta Cristina
Description: Porta Cristina, in Cagliari, is a city gate leading to the Castello district which connects Viale Buoncammino, where the historic prison is located, to Piazza Arsenale.
OpeningTime: {'Monday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Thursday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Friday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Saturday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Sunday': 'Open 24 hour'}

Name: Chiesa di Sant'Eulalia
Description: The collegiate church of Sant'Eulalia is the parish church of the Marina district, in the historic center of Cagliari. Located in the center of the neighborhood in an elevated position compared to the surrounding buildings, the church is preceded by a wide staircase.

Name: Porta San Pancrazio
Description: Cagliari Rising above the skyline by the Castello's northeastern gate, this 36m-high tower is the twin of the Torre dell'Elefante . Completed in 1305, it is built on the city's highest point and commands expansive views of the Golfo di Cagliari.
OpeningTime: {'Monday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Thursday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Friday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Saturday': 'Open 24 hours', 'Sunday': 'Open 24 hours'}
Address: Porta S'Avanzada, Via Ubaldo Badas, 09123 Cagliari CA

Name: Chiesa di San Simone
Description: St Simone's church is located in Sa Illetta, near Santa Gilla's pond, and dates back 16th -17th century. Not very big,the church presents a simple facade,with a big and precious portal,and, in the middle, a small bell.
Address: loc. Sa Illetta, S.da Statale 195 Sulcitana, 09123 Cagliari CA

Name: Chiesa della Speranza
Description: The church of Our Lady of Hope, commonly known as the church of Hope, is located in Cagliari, in the historic Castello district, in via Duomo.
Address: angolo di via del Fossario, Via del Duomo, 09124 Cagliari CA

Name: Convento di San Domenico
Description: The church of San Domenico is a church in Cagliari. It is located in Piazza San Domenico, in the neighborhood called Villanova. The church is officiated by the Dominican friars, who live in the nearby convent.

Name: Statua di San Francesco d'Assisi
Description: The bronze statue of Saint Francesco d'Assisi was placed in Carlo Alberto Square, in the heart of the Castello district, on the occasion of the seventh centenary of his death. There are two statues in Cagliari dedicated to the patron saint of Italy

Name: Chiesa di San Bartolomeo
Description: The church of San Bartolomeo is a parish church in Cagliari. It is located in Piazza San Bartolomeo, in the old area of the neighborhood of the same name.

Name: Piazza Arsenale
Description: The basics. Housed inside the former Royal Arsenal (Regio Arsenale), now known as the Citadel of Museums, the National Museum of Archaeology offers a fascinating overview of Sardinia's ancient history and is a visit here is a must for archaeology enthusiasts.

Name: Chiesa di Nostra Signora del Carmine
Description: Chiesa di Nostra Signora del Carmine is a church in Cagliari, Cagliari. Chiesa di Nostra Signora del Carmine is situated nearby to Piazza del Carmine and Monumento Immacolata Concezione
Image: Chiesa di Nostra Signora del Carmine .jpg

Name: Chiesa Romanica dei SS Lorenzo e Pancrazio
Description: The church of San Lorenzo, also named after San Pancrazio and the Madonna del Buon Cammino, is a medieval church in Cagliari. The small temple is located on the top of the Buon Cammino hill and can be reached by climbing uphill from the avenue of the same name to the panoramic clearing where the church stands.
Address: Via SS. Lorenzo e Pancrazio, 09123 Cagliari CA
Image: Chiesa Romanica dei SS Lorenzo e Pancrazio.jpg

Name: Villa di Tigellio
Description: The so-called Villa di Tigellio is a complex of Roman ruins located in the Stampace district of Cagliari, which erroneously takes its name from Tigellio, a musician and poet originally from Caralis.

Name: Grotta della Vipera
Description: The Viper cave is a Roman funerary hypogeum located in viale Sant'Avendrace, in the Tuvixeddu necropolis, in Cagliari.

Name: Il Planetario de L'Unione Sarda
Description: Cagliari?s planetarium

Name: Cala Bernat
Description: Cala Bernat: known as Su Perdusemmini or Lazzaretto Beach or San Bernardo, Cala Bernat is not an easily accessible beach, and it is advisable to go there swimming or canoeing. Turquoise water and fine limestone sand make this secret beach one of the most fascinating on the island.

Name: Calamosca
Description: Calamosca Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in the city of Calgary if not in Sardinia. Away from settlements with crystal clear water, it offers complete enjoyment of nature, sun, and seawater.

Name: Necropoli di Bonaria
Description: Cagliari, Necropolis of Bonaria The necropolis occupies the western slopes of the Bonaria hill. Bonaria's funerary vocation dates back to the 4th century BC, when, in the middle of the Punic Age, the hill was used as a burial place.

Name: Chiesa di San Pietro Apostolo
Description: Church of Saint Pietro the Apostle The original church dates back to the 16th century an it was the only one in the district ,until the fifties. The building had a Latin cross plan, consisting in a nave and a chapel for each side.

Name: Monumento A Carlo Felice Di Savoia
Description: The monument to Carlo Felice, king of Sardinia, is located in Piazza Yenne, in the heart of Cagliari. It was created in 1830 in neoclassical style by the Sassari sculptor Andrea Galassi, commissioned by the Sardinian Parliament, and depicts the king in the guise of a Roman soldier with helmet, armor and toga.

Name: Palazzo dell'Universita
Description: The University building, also known as Palazzo Belgrano, is a monumental architectural complex in Cagliari, where the offices of the rectorate of the University of Cagliari and the university library are located

Name: Torre dello Sperone
Description: The Torre dello Sperone is a medieval tower in Cagliari, southern Sardinia, Italy. It is located in the Stampace historical quarter of the city. The tower was part of the city's fortifications built in white limestone by the Pisan in the 13th century

Name: Teatro delle Saline
Description: Performing arts theater in Cagliari

Name: Archivio di Stato
Description: The Cagliari State Archives is a peripheral organ of the Ministry for Cultural Heritage and Activities, dependent on the General Directorate of Archives. It provides for the preservation of documents produced by central and peripheral state offices

Name: Chiesa San Pietro dei Pescatori
Description: Near the Romanesque church of San Pietro, funerary inscriptions dating back to the V-VI century AD were found, currently kept at the National Archaeological Museum of Cagliari.

Name: Torre Campanaria della Cattedrale
Description: agliari's graceful 13th-century cathedral stands proudly on Piazza Palazzo. Except for the square-based bell tower, little remains of the original Gothic structure: the clean Pisan-Romanesque facade is a 20th-century imitation, added between 1933 and 1938.

Name: Centro Sportivo Bonaria
Description: Sports complex in Cagliari

Name: Chiesa di San Cesello
Description: Catholic church in Cagliari

Name: Chiesa Di San Giovanni
Description: Catholic church in Cagliari

Name: Civic Market of San Benedetto
Description: The largest covered food market in Italy, with separate departments for produce, fish & more.
Address: Via Francesco Cocco Ortu, 46, 09128 Cagliari CA

Name: Passeggiata del Lungomare di Sant'Elia
Description: A long pedestrian and cycle path close to the sea that from the Nervi park, after crossing a very small boat port and skirting the tiny beach of Canaletto, you arrive at the Lazzaretto square.

Name: Porta dei Leoni (Micene)
Description: The Lions' Gate was the main entrance to the city, so called because of the decorations on the discharge triangle with two lions symmetrically arranged on either side of a column. It dates back to around 1300 BC, and is part of the Cyclopean wall fortification system.

Name: Chiesa di Santa Lucia in Marina (ruderi)
Description: The church of Santa Lucia is of very ancient origin. The area in which it is located, in the immediate vicinity of the port, has always accentuated its importance in the socio-religious context of the city, in all phases of its development.

Name: Chiesa dei Santi Giorgio e Caterina
Description: The church dedicated to the Holy Martyrs Giorgio and Caterina dei Genovesi is located at the top of Via Scano, at the foot of Mount Urpinu. In rooms adjacent to the church, the Museum of the Genovese Archconfraternity can be visited
Image: Chiesa dei Santi Giorgio e Caterina.jpg

Name: Chiesa della Purissima
Description: The Purissima church is a church in the city of Cagliari, located in via Lamarmora, a few steps from Piazza Indipendenza, Castello district, in the historic center.

Name: Chiesa di Sant'Antonio Abate
Description: The church of Sant'Antonio Abate is a monumental church in Cagliari. It overlooks via Giuseppe Manno, in the historic Marina district.

Name: Anfiteatro Romano di Cagliari
Description: The Roman amphitheater of Cagliari is a building from the Roman era, located in Cagliari.
Address: Via Sant'Ignazio da Laconi, 09123 Cagliari CA

Name: Chiesa di San Giuseppe Calasanzio
Description: The church of San Giuseppe Calasanzio is located in Cagliari in Piazzetta San Giuseppe. The church is flanked by the vast complex of the former Piarists' college, which today houses the state artistic high school.

Name: Parco di San Michele
Description: Green space with paths & jogging trails, lawns, pines & a scenic restaurant in a hilltop fortress

Name: Piazza Francesco Paolo Ingrao

Description: The garden under the walls, also known as the Fratelli Giuseppe and Vittorino Fiori garden, is a green area in the historic Villanova district of Cagliari.

Description: Cala Fighera fa parte di un delizioso e suggestivo breve tratto di costa cagliaritana dominata dal promontorio di Capo Sant'Elia

Name: Piazza Palazzo
Description: Piazza Palazzo is the main square of the Castello district in Cagliari. The square owes its prestige to the historical and artistic importance of the buildings that overlook it. It can be reached from the north via via Martini, from the west via via Canelles and from the south via via Duomo and via Fossario

Description: Piazza Giacomo Matteotti is an important square in the city of Cagliari located in the Stampace district. Some of the most important buildings in Cagliari are located here, including the Art Nouveau town hall.

Description: Piazza del Carmine (officially Piazza Carmine) is an important square in the city of Cagliari located in the Stampace district.

Description: Piazza Costituzione is the heart of the city. It is located near Bastione di Saint Remy

Name: Parco Nervi
Description: Il Parco del Nervi, a vast green area equipped with personal and cycling paths. The main feature of the area is the bridge that unites the two sponde del canale di San Bartolomeo. Nervi realized at the structure to improve the extraction and storage system of the neighboring salt mines of Molentargius. Located in the neighborhood of Sant'Elia, originally inhabited by the fishermen of Cagliari, the park, inaugurated in July 2021, proposes to connect, through its bridge, the neighborhood with the rest of the city center.

Name: Chiesa di Cristo Re
Description: The Chiesa di Cristo Re, or the Church of Christ the King, is a prominent religious landmark located in the vibrant city of Cagliari, situated on the picturesque island of Sardinia, Italy.

Name: Museo Etnografico Regionale - Collezione Luigi Cocco
Description: The Luigi Cocco collection is a municipally managed collection of Sardinian works of art and craftsmanship, located in the museum citadel in Cagliari.
Address: Cittadella dei Musei, Piazza Arsenale, 1, 09123 Cagliari CA
Image: Museo Etnografico Regionale - Collezione Luigi Cocco.JPG

Name: Chiesa della Medaglia Miracolosa
Description: The Church of the Miraculous Medal in Cagliari is a Catholic place of worship dedicated to Santa Maria delle Grazie, venerated under the title of the Miraculous Medal. Located in the Via Medaglia Miracolosa of the same name, this church is an important spiritual point of reference for the faithful of the city.

Name: Chiesa di San Lucifero
Description: The church of San Lucifero is a place of worship in Cagliari, home to the parish of the Beata Vergine del Rimedio. The temple is located in via San Lucifero, a short distance from the basilica of San Saturnino, in the Villanova district

Name: Belvedere e Viale di Calamosca
Description: The Belvedere di Calamosca is a spectacular panoramic terrace located in the Calamosca district, in the city of Cagliari, Sardinia. Offering a breathtaking view of the Gulf of Angels, this platform is one of the most evocative places in the city

Name: Monumento ai Caduti delle Guerre d'Indipendenza
Description: The monument to the fallen of the wars of independence of Cagliari is dedicated to the Sardinians who fell in the battles for independence for the unification of Italy

Name: Chiesa di San Massimiliano Kolbe
Description: The Church of San Massimiliano Kolbe is a Catholic place of worship located in the city of Cagliari, Sardinia. It is dedicated to Saint Maximilian Maria Kolbe, a Polish Franciscan friar known for having sacrificed his life during the Holocaust, volunteering to take the place of another prisoner in the Auschwitz concentration camp.

Name: Porta S'Avanzada
Description: Porta S'Avanzada is one of the medieval gates that was part of the ancient walls of the city of Cagliari, located in the area of the historic district of Castello. Its construction dates back to the Pisan period, when Cagliari was a fortified city.

Name: Piazza Yenne
Description: Piazza Yenne, formerly Piazza San Carlo, is one of the most important historic squares in Cagliari located at the end of Largo Carlo Felice in the Stampace district.

Name: Piazza Garibaldi
Description: Piazza Garibaldi, full of large trees, had a complex and articulated formation: its sides were in fact completed at different times, as a function of the large "Riva" school building which became a very significant presence. Even if its current appearance is the result of interventions that took place until the 1960s, Piazza Garibaldi presents its own unity in the layout of the streets that branch off from it and in the presence of buildings dating back mostly to the first half of the twentieth century. Among these, Palazzo Zedda stands out, which is on the corner of Via Macomer, a fine example of rationalist architecture, characterized by its façade with two-tone bands. The square today constitutes one of the focal points of city traffic, channeled by the central flowerbeds, rearranged several times precisely to streamline it. Named after the last of the fallen of the First World War, the very young officer Alberto Riva Villasanta, the elementary school building occupies a vast front on Piazza Garibaldi, extending symmetrically into two wings that enclose a courtyard close to the convent of San Domenico.

Name: Piazza Gramsci
Description: Dedicated to Antonio Gramsci and the result of a rational urban planning project from the late 1930s, the square, characterized by an elongated triangular shape and the presence of large trees, is dominated by the bulk of the Carabinieri Legion building; around it there are numerous residential buildings dating back to the 1930s and larger buildings built in the 1950s and 1960s. The Carabinieri Legion, built between 1930 and 1933, is made in an eclectic style with a strong classicist and mannerist taste. Above the main entrances four bronze sculptures stand out, naked male figures with an allegorical meaning: the Fascist Age, Justice, New Youth and Duty, works by the sculptor Albino Manca. The Parco delle Rimembranze develops adjacent to the Legion, located on the corner between via Sonnino and via San Lucifero. The park, dedicated to the fallen of the First World War, is a fine example of rationalist architecture of fascist inspiration, typical of the 1930s; particularly interesting is the monument to the fallen, built in 1935 by the architect Ubaldo Badas. The monument is composed of two wall facings, formed by a granite base and alternating rows of Serrenti stone and trachyte blocks, made in the shape of a fasces. The names of the main battles fought by Italian soldiers during the First World War are inscribed in relief on the trachyte bands.Behind the monument is the garden of San Lucifero, a recently renovated green area that precedes the church of the same name.

Name: Piazza Carlo Alberto
Description: The square, of modest dimensions, is located in a very central area of the neighborhood, between via Canelles and via La Marmora. Its quadrangular plan has remained almost unchanged since the Middle Ages. In Spanish times, Piazza Carlo Alberto was known as the plazuela (little square), to distinguish it from the Palazzo square, called Plaza Mayor. In the plazuela, nobles condemned to death were executed by beheading.

Name: Piazzetta Savoia
Description: Piazzetta Savoia is named after the House of Savoy, the royal family of Italy until the monarchy was abolished in 1946. The square is surrounded by elegant buildings, cafes, and shops, making it a popular spot for locals and tourists alike to stroll, relax, and enjoy the ambiance of the city.
